description: From Late Latin precatorius, from Latin precari (“to pray”).

adjectives.description: precatory (comparative more precatory, superlative most precatory)

examples: December 8. . . . A precatory letter from Gillies. I must do Molière for him, I suppose; but it is wonderful that knowing the situation I am in, the poor fellow presses so hard.

entries.meaning: (law) Expressing a wish but not creating any legal obligation or duty.
